sentence.text: Mutations in filamin A (negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase I) or post-translational protein modification-ribosylation factor guanine nucleotide-exchange factor 2 (receptor recycling) cause periventricular nodular heterotopia, but most patients with this malformation do not have a known aetiology.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase I

sentence.text: Using whole exome sequencing in 14 patients with isolated periventricular nodular heterotopia but no copy number variants, we identified one patient with periventricular nodular heterotopia, developmental delay and epilepsy and a de novo missense mutation in the chromosome 6 open reading frame 70 (biological_process) gene, mapping in the minimal critical deleted region.
Silencing of the contiguous nervous system development or Notch signaling pathway genes only produced slightly delayed migration but not periventricular nodular heterotopia.

Our data suggest that, of the genes within this minimal critical region, biological_process plays a major role in the control of neuronal migration and its haploinsufficiency or mutation causes periventricular nodular heterotopia.
